On Fri, 18 Aug 2006 at 08:11:33, kultstatus77 wrote:

> Thank you (and the =
others) for the answer. One question, though:
> 
> > Here's another example=
:
> > The JUnit 3 test runners create all test cases before running, and
> =
> keep references to them in memory after running.  Anything kept as field
=
> > references in a test class will not be GC'd until the test runner
> > r=
eleases the test class reference (which is never).
> 
> Doesn't this qualif=
y as a memory leak? Is this a known bug or working
> as designed? Mayby I d=
idn't understand fully what you meant: when the
> TestRunner is done, isn't=
 it GC'ed by itself?
> 
Whether as designed or not, it's poorly suited to r=
unning lots of
resource-intensive tests.  In order to say whether it's a le=
ak or not, you have
to define when the test runner is "done".
